meanings.definition: The quality or state of being textual.
meanings.sent1: The textualities of the book made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed exploring the textualities of different novels.
meanings.sent3: The professor's obsession with textualities led to a funny mix-up in class.
meanings.sent4: The textualities of the ancient manuscript revealed hidden secrets.
meanings.sent5: The student's grasp of textualities impressed the teacher.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or elements of a text.
meanings.sent1: The textualities of the story included vivid descriptions.
meanings.sent2: Analyzing the textualities of the poem helped in understanding its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The detective focused on the textualities of the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: The textualities of the painting conveyed a sense of melancholy.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the textualities of the play enhanced the theater experience.

meanings.definition: The study or analysis of texts.
meanings.sent1: Her interest in textualities led her to pursue a degree in literature.
meanings.sent2: The professor's expertise in textualities was evident in the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The conference on textualities attracted scholars from around the world.
meanings.sent4: The textualities of the ancient scrolls provided valuable insights.
meanings.sent5: His research focused on the textualities of Shakespeare's works.
